intro: Frailea stockingeri, commonly known as the Stockinger's stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing form with fleshy, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple during the warmer months. It is well adapted to dry environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. Due to its unique appearance and resilience, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
